items.title: India's National Critical Minerals Mission at P20
items.summary:
- At P20, Harivansh presented the seven‑year *National Critical Mineral Mission* (FY2024‑25–2030‑31) with ~Rs 16,300 crore and ~Rs 18,000 crore expected investments and 59 auctioned blocks.
- He urged building *resilient value chains*, diversifying supplies via partnerships (Africa, Latin America, Australia) and using training, technology and sustainable practices.
- He noted India's progress in *renewables* (3rd solar, 4th wind/overall), flagship schemes (PM Surya Ghar, PM‑KUSUM, PM JANMAN) and called for parliamentary oversight of climate finance.

items.title: China, Malaysia in talks for rare earths refinery project
Tata Power Renewable signs 80 MW hybrid PPA with Mumbai arm
items.author: ETEnergyWorld Desk
items.summary:
- Tata Power Renewable Energy signed an 80 MW *firm and dispatchable renewable energy (FDRE)* PPA with Tata Power Mumbai Distribution for a hybrid *solar–wind–battery* project to be delivered within 24 months.
- The plant will supply four-hour peak power with *90% availability*, feed Mumbai’s network for about *800,000* customers, and generate roughly *315 million units* annually.
- It is expected to cut over *0.25 million tonnes CO2/year* and raises TPREL’s utility capacity to *11.3 GW* (including *9.4 GW* under PPAs and *5.6 GW* operational).

items.title: Japan's renewable curtailments on track to hit record as nuclear generation rises
Panel Recommends Solar Parks in Punjab Industrial Policy
items.summary:
- The Punjab panel urges a dedicated *land allocation policy* and development of *solar parks* with open access and flexible leasing to retain local industry investment.
- It recommends *capital subsidies*, a push for *local solar manufacturing*, higher rooftop caps for industry and seamless transfer of security deposits to accelerate deployment.
- Also proposed: *inter‑state power transfer* and 1–5 MW *canal‑based hydro* to tap Punjab's 5–6 GW potential and create rural jobs.

items.title: Piyush Goyal meets Airbus chairman to boost India aviation
items.summary:
- Union Minister Piyush Goyal met *Airbus* Chairman Rene Obermann to explore opportunities and encourage deeper *investment* and collaboration in India's aviation sector.

- The talks highlight India's appeal as an *aerospace* hub amid major recent orders, including Air India's 100-aircraft deal and IndiGo's historic 500 A320-family purchase.

- Airbus and Indian partners are expanding capacity and skills, notably a new *pilot training* centre in Gurugram to train 5,000 pilots, signaling long-term commitments.

items.title: Boeing 777X to be delayed to 2027: Reports
items.summary:
- Delivery of *Boeing*'s *777X* is now expected in early *2027*, Bloomberg reports, pushing first delivery back from 2026.
- Launch customer *Deutsche Lufthansa* is excluding the 777X from fleet plans until 2027 and analysts expect a $1–$4 billion charge for Boeing.
- CEO Kelly Ortberg said significant certification work remains; the program has already incurred over $10 billion in charges.

items.title: Global aircraft financiers flag issues with India's repossession draft rule
Tata Projects shifts gears, eyes next-gen manufacturing to chase high margins
Chipmakers add $200 billion in global rally
items.summary:
- Global chipmakers saw combined market cap rise by *$200 billion* as investors rushed into **AI** exposure, lifting indexes and shares such as **SK Hynix**, Samsung and ASML.
- The rally was driven by OpenAI's hefty valuation, its deals with South Korean firms and reports of Intel talks with AMD, stoking *FOMO* and pushing forward P/E to ~19–27x.
- Analysts caution that bubble talk remains and upcoming Q4 earnings may force a reality check despite current *momentum*.

items.title: Andhra CM: Boost indigenous manufacturing and consumption
items.summary:
- Andhra Pradesh CM N. Chandrababu Naidu urged a massive rise in *indigenous manufacturing* and *consumption* to protect culture and boost the economy.
- He highlighted local products like *kondapalli* and *yetikoppaka* toys, hand-woven fabrics and coconut goods, and pledged government support to rejuvenate crafts and improve branding.
- Naidu said Indians should aim to dictate terms globally, predicting India will be the *2nd-largest economy by 2038* and the top by 2047 while visiting a khadi market with PV Sindhu.

items.title: Trac Precision to supply parts for Coolbrook heaters
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- Trac Precision Solutions (PTC Industries) will supply components for Coolbrook’s *RotoDynamic Heater (RDH)*, an electrified system reaching *1,700°C* for steel, cement and petrochemical plants.
- Initial order covers 2 milled blades and 4 cast vanes, scaling to *27,000 parts* yearly across 100 engines with projected revenues over *£10 million*; a second phase adds three more milled parts.
- PTC says the deal diversifies Trac into *industrial decarbonisation*, and Coolbrook calls it a milestone for scaling RDH to high‑volume industrial deployment.

items.title: ECMS: ₹1.15L-cr proposals, 1.41L jobs — Vaishnaw
items.summary:
- Under the *ECMS*, the Centre received proposals totalling *₹1.15 lakh crore*, nearly double the scheme's envisaged *₹59,350 crore*.
- Applicants estimate production of over *₹10.34 lakh crore* (vs *₹4.56 lakh crore* target) and propose *1.41 lakh jobs*, exceeding the 91,600 goal.
- MeitY has begun fast‑tracking approvals; investments span *mobile/IT enclosures*, *HDI/flexible PCB* and *SMD passives*, boosting *domestic value addition* and export potential.

items.title: SKF India to invest ₹1,460 crore by 2030
items.author: ETAuto Desk
items.summary: - The demerger creates two focused entities with combined planned investments of **₹1,460 crore** by 2030 and SKF India (Industrial) is expected to list by November 2025. - The *automotive* arm will invest *₹410–510 crore* to scale capacity in Haridwar, Pune and Bengaluru and capture trends like electrification, hybridisation and advanced safety. - The *industrial* arm will invest *₹800–950 crore* to expand channels, serve sectors such as railways and renewables, and build a new Pune facility by 2028.

items.title: US takes stake in company operating one of world's largest lithium mines in Nevada
Electronics component scheme draws ₹1.15L-cr proposals
items.summary:
- The **Electronics Component Manufacturing Scheme** received *₹1.15 lakh crore* in investment proposals, well above its ~*₹59,000 crore* target.
- Submissions promise *1.41 lakh* jobs versus the scheme target of *91,600*, and applications for capital‑equipment segments remain open.
- Officials say the oversubscription signals strong industry interest and could accelerate domestic *electronics* production and supply‑chain growth.

items.title: Electronics Component Scheme draws ₹1.15L-cr, beats targets
items.summary:
- The *Electronics Component Manufacturing Scheme* drew proposals totalling **₹1.15 lakh crore**, far exceeding the original ~₹59,000 crore projection.
- Officials expect the proposals to create *1.41 lakh jobs*, surpassing the scheme’s 91,600-job target and beating investment and production goals.
- The application window closed on Sept 30 for most segments, while the *capital equipment* window remains open, indicating ongoing investor interest in India’s electronics push.

items.title: India’s copper industry sounds alarm as UAE imports surge under CEPA
Hyundai starts passenger vehicle production at Talegaon
items.author: ETAuto Desk
items.summary:
- Production began on Oct 1, 2025 at Hyundai's refurbished *Talegaon plant* in Maharashtra, marking the start of passenger vehicle assembly.
- The facility, formerly owned by General Motors, has been upgraded to Hyundai's global standards with an annual installed capacity of *1.7 lakh units* to support domestic demand and *exports*.
- Hyundai expects the plant to boost *localisation*, create jobs and strengthen its long-term manufacturing footprint in India’s fast-growing auto market.

items.title: Linc–Mitsubishi Pencil JV commences operations in India
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- Linc Ltd and *Mitsubishi Pencil* launched the new JV *Uni Linc India* (valued ~₹20 crore) and inaugurated production at a Gujarat facility on Oct 1, 2025.
- Mitsubishi holds **51%** and Linc **49%**; manufacturing begins with ballpoint pens priced for India's high‑volume market and will expand into value‑added *Uni* instruments.
- The tie‑up leverages Linc's distribution and Mitsubishi's Japanese technology to deliver global‑quality, affordable products and position India as a strategic hub.

items.title: DGTR starts countervailing duty probe into Chinese aluminium foil
India ready to rev up chipmaking, says industry pioneer
Sonos targets India as premium audio demand rises
items.author: Javed Farooqui, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- Sonos is targeting *India*—a fast-growing APAC market—expanding to 75 retail outlets, a luxury centre and *Sonos Sound Suites* to fuel **premium** installed systems.
- Despite an 8.3% decline in *FY24* revenue, Sonos is widening availability and partner integrations (Works with Sonos, API); manufacturing is in Malaysia/Vietnam, not India.
- GfK cites home audio growth but falling system volumes; Sonos faces Bose, Sony, Google and Amazon and is doubling down on **wireless multi-room audio** and design.

items.title: Centre amends schedules for e-buses, trucks
items.author: Kriti Saraiya, ETAuto
items.summary:
- The Ministry of Heavy Industries amended the PM E-Drive *phased manufacturing programme*, taking effect on *March 3, 2026* for e-buses and *March 1, 2026* for e-trucks.
- Revised PMP mandates local manufacturing of *traction motors* (magnet fitment, rotor/stator, shaft/bearing, enclosure, connectors, cables) and full domestic production/assembly of integrated traction motor‑transmission systems for N2 trucks.
- The stricter localisation rules tie subsidies under the ₹10,900-crore *PM E-Drive* scheme to increased domestic value addition to boost India’s EV supply chain.

items.title: India to speed hydropower approvals to meet green goals
items.author: Rajesh Kumar Singh, Bloomberg
items.summary:
- India will *outsource geological investigations* and hire external experts at the *Central Electricity Authority (CEA)* to *expedite approvals* and design for hydropower and pumped-storage projects.
- Though estimated potential is ~*150 GW*, only ~*55 GW* (about *11%* of the mix) is installed and nearly 30 GW of CEA-approved projects are stalled by environmental clearances, design revisions and social resistance.
- Accelerating approvals is meant to meet India’s *energy transition* targets, but large dams—especially in the *Himalayas*—raise environmental, landslide and climate‑risk concerns.

items.title: KP Group signs pact to explore green hydrogen opportunities
items.summary:
- KP Group has signed an MoU with *Jeonbuk Province*, GH2 Solar and AHES to explore **green hydrogen** and *clean energy* opportunities.
- The agreement focuses on *technology exchange* in water electrolysis and hydrogen facilities and joint development of large-scale projects across India and abroad.
- The partnership aims to expand the *global green hydrogen market* and strengthen international cooperation for long-term decarbonisation.

items.title: Indian Railways emerging as global exporter
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- Indian Railways is becoming a *global exporter* under **Make in India**, sending bogies, coaches, locomotives and propulsion systems to over *16 countries*.
- Marhowra Plant has exported six locomotives to Guinea and secured a second order—~150 **Evolution Series (4,500 HP)** units for Africa, prized for *fuel efficiency* and high‑temp performance.
- Shipments (metro coaches, bogies, propulsion systems) to markets including Australia, Canada, UK, Europe, Africa and Latin America highlight *public‑private partnerships* and India’s role in the *global railway supply chain*.

items.title: European Union to increase tariffs on steel imports
items.summary:
- The European Commission will propose a long-term mechanism to raise *tariffs* on *steel* imports and cut import *quotas* by almost half to shield EU producers.
- Imports beyond reduced quotas would face higher duties mirroring other jurisdictions (the US levies 50%), replacing a temporary 25% safeguard that expires next year.
- The measure seeks to protect jobs and secure defence-related steel supply amid Asian overcapacity and shifting global trade rules, industry groups say.

items.title: Samsung, SK Hynix to supply memory chips to OpenAI's Stargate project
US-based Sonos bets on India as premium audio demand rises despite global slowdown
Satellite startup Spacecoin sends data through space in bid to rival Starlink
Qualcomm shifts chips to newer Arm tech as competition with Apple, MediaTek heats up
"We cannot ignore research and development": Defence Minister Rajnath Singh calls for innovative ecosystem to boost India's defence sector
Meta to acquire Rivos to boost chip efforts
items.summary:
- Meta intends to acquire chip startup Rivos, which designs *RISC‑V*‑based processors and was nearing a ~$2 billion valuation to strengthen its semiconductor capabilities.
- The move is meant to accelerate Meta's in‑house **custom silicon** work (its MTIA accelerators); Meta has been a major Rivos customer and is testing its own AI training chips to curb reliance on Nvidia.
- Financial terms were not disclosed and reports from Reuters and Bloomberg say talks were ongoing based on anonymous sources.

items.title: Qualcomm shifts chips to newer Arm tech as competition with Apple, MediaTek heats up
Canadian manufacturing PMI slips in September
items.summary:
- The S&P Global Canada Manufacturing PMI fell to *47.7* in September from 48.3, marking the eighth straight month below **50** and signalling continued sector contraction.
- Output and new orders declined (output *46.4*; new orders *46.1*), with exports weak and firms cutting purchasing, inventories and employment amid an uncertain trading environment.
- Price pressures eased (input costs *57.3* from 61.6; output prices *51.2*, lowest since Oct 2024), backing the Bank of Canada's recent 25‑bp cut to **2.50%**.

items.title: Walmart sets a timeline for removing synthetic dyes and other additives from its food brands
Trump's 100% tariff threat forces Pfizer to cut drug prices and boost US manufacturing
LG India IPO seeks to make India a global manufacturing hub
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- LG Electronics India is reviving its IPO to raise *116 billion rupees* (~$1.3B) at an expected valuation of *$8.73B*, with the parent selling a 15% stake.
- The unit has invested *$600M* in an Andhra Pradesh factory to boost exports (currently $160M, 6% of revenue) and position India as a global manufacturing hub serving Europe and 47 countries.
- The listing, with a price band of *₹1,080–1,140*, is supported by lower electronics taxes and strong domestic demand, forming part of a busy IPO season in India.

items.title: GST collections rise by 9% to ₹1.89 lakh crores in September
US private sector sheds jobs in September — ADP
items.summary:
- ADP reported the US private sector *shed 32,000 jobs* in September, with biggest losses in *leisure & hospitality*, *professional services* and *financial activities*, and contractions in trade, transportation & utilities and manufacturing.
- *Average pay* rose *4.5% YoY* while pay gains for job-changers cooled to *6.6%*, and ADP's annual *benchmarked* adjustment subtracted *43,000 jobs* from September's pre-benchmarked total.
- The miss raises concerns for policymakers after the Fed's first 2025 rate cut, though economists warn *ADP data* can diverge from official government figures.

items.title: Airbus, Tata Advanced Systems to build India’s first private helicopter assembly line in Karnataka
SKF India demerges industrial arm; listing by Nov 2025
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- SKF India completed a demerger on Oct 1, 2025, creating *SKF India (Industrial) Ltd* while *SKF Automotive* remains the automotive arm; shareholders receive one new industrial share per existing share.
- The industrial unit is expected to be **listed by Nov 2025** (subject to approvals) and will invest *₹800–950 crore* by 2030 including a *Pune* plant, while *SKF Automotive* will invest *₹410–510 crore* to expand *EV* and wheel-end capacity.
- Both firms will have independent boards and governance and will leverage SKF’s global technology to target *infrastructure, railways, renewables, manufacturing* and *electrification* growth.

items.title: Nestle India signs MoU with Food Processing Ministry
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- Nestlé India signed an *MoU* with the Ministry of Food Processing Industries at the World Food India Summit to pursue *greenfield* and *brownfield investments* in Odisha and at its existing plants.
- The agreement targets implementation over the next *2–3 years*, aiming to generate both direct and indirect **employment** and support the *Atmanirbhar Bharat* agenda.
- Nestlé India operates *nine factories*, works with over *100,000 farmers*, reaches 5.2 million retail outlets and says its community programmes have impacted more than 16 million people.

items.title: PNGRB report maps step-wise hydrogen blending: 2% safe, 20% only with new infra
Euro zone manufacturing slips back into contraction in September
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- The HCOB *Eurozone Manufacturing PMI* fell to **49.8** in September from 50.7 in August, returning the sector to *contraction* as new orders — led by weaker *exports* — dropped at their fastest pace in six months.
- Factory output still grew (50.9 vs 52.5) but momentum slowed, while *employment* worsened with firms cutting jobs at the fastest rate in three months and continuing to reduce selling prices.
- The picture was uneven: the Netherlands, Greece, Ireland and Spain expanded, but the bloc's big economies (*Germany, France, Italy*) contracted and business confidence fell to its weakest since April.

items.title: Greek manufacturing growth slows in September, PMI shows
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- Greece's manufacturing PMI eased to *52.0* in September from 54.5, signaling slower expansion though still above the 50.0 growth threshold.
- Input costs rose at their slowest pace since November 2023, yet firms continued raising selling prices and S&P forecasts *CPI 3.1%* for 2025, above the ECB's 2% target.
- New export orders fell for a fifth month, but rising employment, sustained domestic demand and activity in construction/real estate kept the sector buoyant and the outlook optimistic.

items.title: UK manufacturing shrinks at fastest pace in 5 months, PMI shows
Boeing eyes recovery amid talks of new single-aisle jet
items.summary:
- Boeing says teams are focused on its *recovery*, delivering nearly **6,000** commercial airplanes backlog and certifying new models (737‑7, 737‑10, 777‑9).
- The company is *evaluating the market* and technology and may develop a new **single-aisle jet** to succeed the 737 MAX when timing is right.
- Rival *Airbus* has outpaced Boeing in single‑aisle orders since 2020 (A320: 4,540 vs 737 MAX: 3,300) after Boeing's recent crises including a 2024 mid‑air accident and a 53‑day strike.

items.title: RBI holds repo rate steady at 5.5%
items.author: ETGovernment Desk
items.summary:
- The RBI's Monetary Policy Committee voted *unanimously* to keep the **repo rate** at *5.5%*, maintaining the current policy stance.
- Other key rates remain unchanged with SDF at *5.25%* and MSF/Bank Rate at *5.75%*, keeping the liquidity corridor intact.
- Governor Malhotra cited strong Q1 growth aided by a good monsoon and a moderation in *headline inflation* amid changing global developments as supporting the decision.
